item.title: Establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2006, revising appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal year 2005, and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2007 through 2010.

latestAction.text: Senate agreed to conference report by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 47. Record Vote Number: 114.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 196 (Roll no. 79). (text: CR H1536)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 196 (Roll no. 79).(text: CR H1536)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 202 (Roll no. 78). (consideration: CR H1544)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 154.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H1536-1545)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 12.

After passage of H. Con. Res. 95, it shall be in order to consider in the House S. Con. Res. 18; to move to strike all after the resolving clause of S. Con. Res. 18 and to insert the provisions of H. Con. Res. 95, as passed by the House.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-19, by Mr. Putnam.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-19, by Mr. Putnam.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 95) establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2006, revising appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal year 2005, and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2007 through 2010.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
